alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 24 at 12:19AM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN MCINTOSH AND WESTERN PITTSBURG COUNTIES THROUGH 100 AM CDT... At 1219 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Hoffman to 3 miles north of Scipio to 3 miles west of Stuart. Movement was southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Mcalester... Eufaula... Krebs... Kiowa... Savanna... Crowder... Canadian... Indianola... Hanna... Ashland... Stidham... Raiford... Haywood... Vivian... Arrowhead State Park... Mcalester Regional Airport... Scipio... Arpelar... Vernon... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 244 and 250. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 600 AM CDT for southeastern and northeastern Oklahoma.
